item.title: Charlie Hebdo: Stabbings suspect 'was trying to target magazine'
item.description: Two people were seriously injured in the attack near the Paris ex-offices of the satirical magazine.

item.title: Lebanon's PM-designate Adib fails to form new government after blast
item.description: The previous cabinet resigned in August amid angry calls for reform after the Beirut port explosion.

item.title: Amy Coney Barrett 'to be picked by Trump for Supreme Court'
item.description: The 48-year-old judge and former law professor from Indiana is a favourite of social conservatives.

item.title: Coronavirus: Madrid at serious risk without tougher rules, minister warns
item.description: Spain's health minister urges more restrictions in Madrid, stoking a political row as cases spike.

item.title: Deepika Padukone: Bollywood star questioned in Sushant Singh Rajput investigation
item.description: Deepika Padukone and other stars were summoned in a drugs investigation after an actor's death.

item.title: Sparks fly during police chase in Los Angeles
item.description: Watch what happened when California Police tried to to pull over a speeding pick-up truck.

item.title: Coronavirus: More than a quarter of UK under stricter rules
item.description: More parts of south Wales and northern England see local lockdown restrictions start this weekend.

item.title: Covid: Clashes as police shut down protest over new rules
item.description: At least three protesters and four officers are injured in London, while 10 people are arrested.

item.title: Tasmania pilot whales: Rescuers release 108 surviving animals
item.description: Efforts now turn to the disposal of some 350 whale carcasses after Australia's worst ever stranding.

item.title: Switzerland gets ready to vote on ending free movement with EU
item.description: Switzerland isn't in the EU, but it does enjoy access to free trade - on condition of it also having free movement.

item.title: NZ's Ardern pays tribute to officer shot in London
item.description: Police investigating the killing of Sgt Matiu Ratana say they are searching four crime scenes.

item.title: Ukraine military plane crash: Cadets among 26 people killed
item.description: The aircraft, carrying air force cadets, was on a training flight when it came down near Kharkiv.

item.title: Courtroom escape sends police officer flying down stairs
item.description: A deputy went down the stairs head first trying to catch the defendant as he made a run for it.

item.title: Mumbai collapse: The man who filmed his ordeal under rubble
item.description: Khalid Khan was trapped for 10 hours after a building collapsed in the Indian city of Mumbai.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sea swims help with lockdown mental health
item.description: More than 100 people are taking part in weekly sea swims at dawn after seeing a social media post.

item.title: Week in pictures: 19 - 25 September 2020
item.description: A selection of remarkable images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Sir David Attenborough breaks Jennifer Aniston's Instagram record
item.description: The broadcaster gains a million followers within five hours of joining the platform.

item.title: The fight for women's prayer rights in Israel
item.description: How a group of Jewish feminists demanded the same prayer rights as Jewish men.

item.title: Breonna Taylor: ‘Painful to be a black woman right now' says Yandy Smith-Harris
item.description: Activist and businesswoman Yandy Smith-Harris shares her reaction to the Breonna Taylor case decision.

item.title: 'Maskne': How to fight face mask breakouts
item.description: They're a part of everyday life, so how can you wear a face mask and have clear skin too?

item.title: Polio campaigners battle misinformation and distrust
item.description: Pakistan and neighbouring Afghanistan are the only two countries in the world yet to eliminate wild polio.

item.title: Covid-19: China's dilemma over wild meat trade
item.description: Breeding snakes and types of rat for food or medicine is a source of income for some of China's poorest people.

item.title: Mine-detecting rat receives prestigious gold medal
item.description: Mine-detecting rat, Magawa, has sniffed out dozens of landmines and unexploded munitions in Cambodia.

item.title: The threat of 'vaccine nationalism'
item.description: Ros Atkins looks at why vaccine nationalism is a growing concern in the global effort to tackle Covid-19.

item.title: Rimbaud and Verlaine: France agonises over digging up gay poets
item.description: There is mounting pressure to have two of France's best-loved poets reinterred in the Paris Pantheon.

item.title: Philippines Troll Patrol: The woman taking on trolls on their own turf
item.description: Pro-government trolling has become rampant online in the Philippines, but some people have had enough.

item.title: Barga: How Italy's most Scottish town coped without its annual 'invasion'
item.description: The population of Barga in Tuscany is usually swelled by visits from Scottish Italians every summer.

item.title: Singapore in world first for facial verification
item.description: The technology is being rolled out countrywide as part of Singapore's national identity scheme.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'We're Australian but we're trapped in the UK'
item.description: Thousands of Australians are stuck in the UK after struggling to return due to strict travel rules.

item.title: The German medical students who want to learn about abortion
item.description: Lack of training is restricting access to abortion in Germany, but students are trying to change that.

item.title: 'One day everyone will use China's digital currency'
item.description: China plans a digital version of its currency, which some say could become a big global payment system.

item.title: PMC Bank collapse: 'We lost our money and then our son'
item.description: Little has changed one year after nearly a million Indians lost their savings in a bank collapse.

item.title: Brighton 2-3 Man Utd: Dramatic injury-time penalty gives Manchester United victory
item.description: A dramatic injury-time penalty gives Manchester United victory at Brighton and their first three points of the season in a stunning game at Amex Stadium.

item.title: Crystal Palace 1-2 Everton: Toffees maintain perfect start at Selhurst Park
item.description: Everton continue their perfect start to the season with a deserved victory against Crystal Palace at Selhurst Park.

item.title: Hamilton takes Russian GP pole after time cut drama
item.description: Lewis Hamilton takes a dramatic pole position at the Russian Grand Prix despite coming within a second of qualifying down in 15th.

item.title: England v West Indies: Nat Sciver makes 82 as hosts win T20 series
item.description: England cruise to a 20-run win over West Indies to take an unassailable 3-0 lead in the five-match Twenty20 series in Derby.

item.title: Murray set for 'amusing' Wawrinka match, with Konta & Evans also in action on day one
item.description: The opening day of the French Open sees three Britons - Andy Murray, Johanna Konta and Dan Evans - playing at Roland Garros.

item.title: Exeter beat Toulouse to reach Champions Cup final for first time
item.description: Exeter grind down free-running, fast-starting Toulouse to make the Champions Cup final for the first time in the club's history.

item.title: Transracial adoption: 'I've been accused of kidnapping my white child'
item.description: How one man went from being a “street kid” in Uganda, to adopting a white child in the US.

item.title: Why the case of a maid who battled a millionaire has gripped Singapore
item.description: The case described by some as a "David versus Goliath battle" has stirred up debate in Singapore.

item.title: Coronavirus economy: The 'banker ladies' saving friends from debt
item.description: Amid a pandemic and economic crisis, minority communities turn to traditional saving methods to help.

item.title: Brazil's Amazon: Fireman 'saving what's not burnt'
item.description: Carlos Rodrigues is among the firefighters trying to save patches of Brazil's rainforest from burning.

item.title: Six African heritage sites under threat from climate change
item.description: A recent study warns that without intervention many of the continent's ancient sites could be lost.

item.title: ‘Our foster child asked us to adopt him – by drawing himself on to a family photo’
item.description: George was neglected by his parents, then an adoption went wrong. There was only one family that he felt loved by.
